intro: Ardisia grandidens, commonly known as the red-berried evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in shaded, moist environments. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the spring. Following flowering, it produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Ardisia grandidens is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ability to form dense, evergreen thickets.
